abstract: Emails and letters appear to reveal closer relationship between Jeb Bush and convicted felon Tony Campos than Bush has claimed; Campos, Cuban immigrant and longtime Miami-Dade County Republican committee member, used his ties with then Florida Gov Bush to obtain around $1.2 million in state grants for proposed museum honoring Bush's grandmother Dorothy; was charged in 2007 with multiple felonies related to misuse of funds for museum, which was never built.
lead_paragraph: A case of misplaced trust offers a cautionary tale about the downside of the vast network of friends and supporters that has been an essential part of the Bush family’s political success.

headline.main: Jeb Bush, Family Ties and a Museum That Never Materialized
headline.print_headline: Museum Scheme Exploited Links to Bush Family

snippet: A case of misplaced trust offers a cautionary tale about the downside of the vast network of friends and supporters that has been an essential part of the Bush family’s political success.
